Message: Hi, Iâ€™m the NewsBreak Ad Assistant. How can I help?
The user completes the submission of the form

Hi, I`m Ann from Homequote company. We just create account in your platform. And I want to ask a couple of questions . Do you have a Business Manager structure or it`s only separate accounts that we have to create apart.

Hi Anna! Welcome to News Break. We do have a structure that allows you to manage multiple ad accounts under one organization. Your organization is usually your company name, and you can create separate ad accounts for different campaigns or products. This way, you don't need to create separate accounts for each campaign. You can manage all your ad accounts under one organization. For more details, you can check out our Account Management Guide here: [Account Management Guide](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/17539290349709-Account-Management-Guide). Let me know if you have any other questions!
thanks, and Pixel I have to use for 1 account or 1 pixel for 2-3 accounts?

You're welcome, Anna! For the pixel, it's generally recommended to use one pixel per ad account to ensure accurate tracking and optimization for each specific campaign. Using separate pixels for different ad accounts helps in better targeting and performance analysis. If you need more detailed guidance on setting up and managing pixels, feel free to ask!
You're welcome, Anna! If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to reach out. Have a great day!
do you have credit line under 1 organization? and how can we open it?

Hi Ann! Yes, you can have a credit line under one organization. To open it, you'll need to add your credit card on file for autopay or prepay options. If you're interested in postpay (net30), this option is available to scaling advertisers after 30 days of spend. For more details, you can check out our FAQ here: [newsbreak FAQ](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/17539290349709-Account-Management-Guide).
Hi one more question do yoy have desctop traffic?
Hi Ann, yes, we do have desktop traffic. If you need more detailed information about our traffic sources or any other specifics, feel free to ask!
